BldgsProperties.description:
Properties for building surfaces including roofs and walls.

Building surfaces are complex urban elements that interact with radiation,
store heat, and influence local wind patterns. They include both roof and
wall components with distinct thermal and radiative properties.

soilstorecap.description: Maximum water storage capacity of soil layer, representing total water holding capacity between field capacity and wilting point. Site-specific value dependent on soil texture, structure, and depth

EmissionsMethod.description:
Method for calculating anthropogenic heat flux (QF) and CO2 emissions.

0: OBSERVED - Uses observed QF values from forcing file (set to zero to exclude QF from energy balance)
1: L11 - Loridan et al. (2011) SAHP method with air temperature and population density
2: J11 - Järvi et al. (2011) SAHP_2 method with heating/cooling degree days
3: L11_UPDATED - Modified Loridan method using daily mean air temperature
4: J19 - Järvi et al. (2019) method with building energy, metabolism, and traffic
5: J19_UPDATED - As method 4 but also calculates CO2 emissions
11: BIOGEN_RECT_L11 - Rectangular hyperbola photosynthesis + L11 QF (experimental)
12: BIOGEN_RECT_J11 - Rectangular hyperbola photosynthesis + J11 QF (experimental)
13: BIOGEN_RECT_L11U - Rectangular hyperbola photosynthesis + L11_UPDATED QF (experimental)
14: BIOGEN_RECT_J19 - Rectangular hyperbola photosynthesis + J19 QF (experimental)
15: BIOGEN_RECT_J19U - Rectangular hyperbola photosynthesis + J19_UPDATED QF (experimental)
21: BIOGEN_NRECT_L11 - Non-rectangular hyperbola (Bellucco 2017) + L11 QF (experimental)
22: BIOGEN_NRECT_J11 - Non-rectangular hyperbola (Bellucco 2017) + J11 QF (experimental)
23: BIOGEN_NRECT_L11U - Non-rectangular hyperbola (Bellucco 2017) + L11_UPDATED QF (experimental)
24: BIOGEN_NRECT_J19 - Non-rectangular hyperbola (Bellucco 2017) + J19 QF (experimental)
25: BIOGEN_NRECT_J19U - Non-rectangular hyperbola (Bellucco 2017) + J19_UPDATED QF (experimental)
41: BIOGEN_COND_L11 - Conductance-based photosynthesis (Järvi 2019) + L11 QF (experimental)
42: BIOGEN_COND_J11 - Conductance-based photosynthesis (Järvi 2019) + J11 QF (experimental)
43: BIOGEN_COND_L11U - Conductance-based photosynthesis (Järvi 2019) + L11_UPDATED QF (experimental)
44: BIOGEN_COND_J19 - Conductance-based photosynthesis (Järvi 2019) + J19 QF (experimental)
45: BIOGEN_COND_J19U - Conductance-based photosynthesis (Järvi 2019) + J19_UPDATED QF (experimental)
EmissionsMethod.title: EmissionsMethod

FAIMethod.description:
Method for calculating frontal area index (FAI) - the ratio of frontal area to plan area.

0: USE_PROVIDED - Use FAI values provided in site parameters (FAIBldg, FAIEveTree, FAIDecTree)
1: SIMPLE_SCHEME - Calculate FAI using simple scheme based on surface fractions and heights (see issue #192)

HDD_ID.description:
Heating Degree Days and related meteorological tracking parameters.

This structure maintains both current day accumulations (fields 1-6) and
previous day values (fields 7-12) for various meteorological parameters
used in anthropogenic heat and water use calculations.
HDD_ID.title: Heating Degree Days

HeatRoughnessMethod.description:
Method for calculating thermal roughness length (z0h).

1: BRUTSAERT - Brutsaert (1982) z0h = z0m/10 (see Grimmond & Oke 1986)
2: KAWAI - Kawai et al. (2009) formulation
3: VOOGT_GRIMMOND - Voogt and Grimmond (2000) formulation
4: KANDA - Kanda et al. (2007) formulation
5: ADAPTIVE - Adaptively using z0m based on pervious coverage: if fully pervious, use method 1; otherwise, use method 2
HeatRoughnessMethod.title: HeatRoughnessMethod

basete.description: Base temperature for initiating senescence degree days (SDD) for leaf off

sddfull.description: Senescence degree days (SDD) needed to initiate leaf off
sddfull.display_name: Senescence Degree Days for Leaf Off

laipower.description: LAI calculation power parameters for growth and senescence

laitype.description: LAI calculation choice (0: original, 1: new high latitude)

LUMPSParams.description: LUMPS model parameters for surface moisture.
LUMPSParams.title: LUMPS Parameters

LandCover.description:
Surface properties for the seven SUEWS land cover types.

SUEWS divides the urban surface into seven distinct surface types, each with
unique thermal, radiative, and hydrological properties. The surface fractions
(sfr) for all seven types must sum to 1.0 for each site.

paved.description: Properties for paved surfaces like roads and pavements

bldgs.description: Properties for building surfaces including roofs and walls

evetr.description: Properties for evergreen trees and vegetation

dectr.description: Properties for deciduous trees and vegetation

water.description: Properties for water surfaces like lakes and ponds

LandCover.title: Land Cover

control.description: Model control parameters including timestep, output options, etc.

physics.description: Model physics parameters including surface properties, coefficients, etc.

tstep.description: Time step in seconds for model calculations
tstep.title: Tstep

forcing_file.description: Path(s) to meteorological forcing data file(s). This can be either: (1) A single file path as a string (e.g., 'forcing.txt'), or (2) A list of file paths (e.g., ['forcing_2020.txt', 'forcing_2021.txt', 'forcing_2022.txt']). When multiple files are provided, they will be automatically concatenated in chronological order. The forcing data contains time-series meteorological measurements that drive SUEWS simulations. For detailed information about required variables, file format, and data preparation guidelines, see :ref:`met_input`.
forcing_file.title: Forcing File

output_file.description: Output file configuration. DEPRECATED: String values are ignored and will issue a warning. Please use an OutputConfig object specifying format ('txt' or 'parquet'), frequency (seconds, must be multiple of tstep), and groups to save (for txt format only). Example: {'format': 'parquet', 'freq': 3600} or {'format': 'txt', 'freq': 1800, 'groups': ['SUEWS', 'DailyState', 'ESTM']}. For detailed information about output variables and file structure, see :ref:`output_files`.
output_file.title: Output File

start_time.description: Start time of model run. If None use forcing data bounds.
start_time.title: Start Time

end_time.description: End time of model run. If None use forcing data bounds.
end_time.title: End Time

netradiationmethod.description: Method for calculating net all-wave radiation (Q*). Options: 0 (OBSERVED) = Uses observed Q* values from forcing file; 1 (LDOWN_OBSERVED) = Models Q* using NARP (Net All-wave Radiation Parameterization; Offerle et al. 2003, Loridan et al. 2011) with observed longwave down radiation (L↓) from forcing file; 2 (LDOWN_CLOUD) = Models Q* using NARP with L↓ estimated from cloud cover fraction; 3 (LDOWN_AIR) = Models Q* using NARP with L↓ estimated from air temperature and relative humidity; 11 (LDOWN_SURFACE) = Surface temperature variant of method 1 (not recommended); 12 (LDOWN_CLOUD_SURFACE) = Surface temperature variant of method 2 (not recommended); 13 (LDOWN_AIR_SURFACE) = Surface temperature variant of method 3 (not recommended); 100 (LDOWN_ZENITH) = Zenith angle correction variant of method 1 (not recommended); 200 (LDOWN_CLOUD_ZENITH) = Zenith angle correction variant of method 2 (not recommended); 300 (LDOWN_AIR_ZENITH) = Zenith angle correction variant of method 3 (not recommended); 1001 (LDOWN_SS_OBSERVED) = SPARTACUS-Surface integration with observed L↓ (experimental); 1002 (LDOWN_SS_CLOUD) = SPARTACUS-Surface integration with L↓ from cloud fraction (experimental); 1003 (LDOWN_SS_AIR) = SPARTACUS-Surface integration with L↓ from air temperature/humidity (experimental)
netradiationmethod.title: Netradiationmethod

emissionsmethod.description: Method for calculating anthropogenic heat flux (QF) and CO2 emissions. Options: 0 (OBSERVED) = Uses observed QF values from forcing file (set to zero to exclude QF from energy balance); 1 (L11) = Loridan et al. (2011) SAHP method with air temperature and population density; 2 (J11) = Järvi et al. (2011) SAHP_2 method with heating/cooling degree days; 3 (L11_UPDATED) = Modified Loridan method using daily mean air temperature; 4 (J19) = Järvi et al. (2019) method with building energy, metabolism, and traffic; 5 (J19_UPDATED) = As method 4 but also calculates CO2 emissions; 11 (BIOGEN_RECT_L11) = Rectangular hyperbola photosynthesis + L11 QF (experimental); 12 (BIOGEN_RECT_J11) = Rectangular hyperbola photosynthesis + J11 QF (experimental); 13 (BIOGEN_RECT_L11U) = Rectangular hyperbola photosynthesis + L11_UPDATED QF (experimental); 14 (BIOGEN_RECT_J19) = Rectangular hyperbola photosynthesis + J19 QF (experimental); 15 (BIOGEN_RECT_J19U) = Rectangular hyperbola photosynthesis + J19_UPDATED QF (experimental); 21 (BIOGEN_NRECT_L11) = Non-rectangular hyperbola (Bellucco 2017) + L11 QF (experimental); 22 (BIOGEN_NRECT_J11) = Non-rectangular hyperbola (Bellucco 2017) + J11 QF (experimental); 23 (BIOGEN_NRECT_L11U) = Non-rectangular hyperbola (Bellucco 2017) + L11_UPDATED QF (experimental); 24 (BIOGEN_NRECT_J19) = Non-rectangular hyperbola (Bellucco 2017) + J19 QF (experimental); 25 (BIOGEN_NRECT_J19U) = Non-rectangular hyperbola (Bellucco 2017) + J19_UPDATED QF (experimental); 41 (BIOGEN_COND_L11) = Conductance-based photosynthesis (Järvi 2019) + L11 QF (experimental); 42 (BIOGEN_COND_J11) = Conductance-based photosynthesis (Järvi 2019) + J11 QF (experimental); 43 (BIOGEN_COND_L11U) = Conductance-based photosynthesis (Järvi 2019) + L11_UPDATED QF (experimental); 44 (BIOGEN_COND_J19) = Conductance-based photosynthesis (Järvi 2019) + J19 QF (experimental); 45 (BIOGEN_COND_J19U) = Conductance-based photosynthesis (Järvi 2019) + J19_UPDATED QF (experimental)
emissionsmethod.title: Emissionsmethod

storageheatmethod.description: Method for calculating storage heat flux (ΔQS). Options: 0 (OBSERVED) = Uses observed ΔQS values from forcing file; 1 (OHM_WITHOUT_QF) = Objective Hysteresis Model using Q* only (use with OhmIncQf=0); 3 (ANOHM) = Analytical OHM (Sun et al., 2017) - not recommended; 4 (ESTM) = Element Surface Temperature Method (Offerle et al., 2005) - not recommended; 5 (EHC) = Explicit Heat Conduction model with separate roof/wall/ground temperatures; 6 (DyOHM) = Dynamic Objective Hysteresis Model (Liu et al., 2025) with dynamic coefficients; 7 (STEBBS) = use STEBBS storage heat flux for building, others use OHM
storageheatmethod.title: Storageheatmethod

ohmincqf.description: Controls inclusion of anthropogenic heat flux in OHM storage heat calculations. Options: 0 (EXCLUDE) = Use Q* only (required when StorageHeatMethod=1); 1 (INCLUDE) = Use Q*+QF (for other OHM-based storage heat methods)
ohmincqf.title: Ohmincqf

roughlenmommethod.description: Method for calculating momentum roughness length (z0m). Options: 1 (FIXED) = Fixed roughness length from site parameters; 2 (VARIABLE) = Variable based on vegetation LAI using rule of thumb (Grimmond & Oke 1999); 3 (MACDONALD) = MacDonald et al. (1998) morphometric method based on building geometry; 4 (LAMBDAP_DEPENDENT) = Varies with plan area fraction λp (Grimmond & Oke 1999); 5 (ALTERNATIVE) = Alternative variable method
roughlenmommethod.title: Roughlenmommethod

roughlenheatmethod.description: Method for calculating thermal roughness length (z0h). Options: 1 (BRUTSAERT) = Brutsaert (1982) z0h = z0m/10 (see Grimmond & Oke 1986); 2 (KAWAI) = Kawai et al. (2009) formulation; 3 (VOOGT_GRIMMOND) = Voogt and Grimmond (2000) formulation; 4 (KANDA) = Kanda et al. (2007) formulation; 5 (ADAPTIVE) = Adaptively using z0m based on pervious coverage: if fully pervious, use method 1; otherwise, use method 2
roughlenheatmethod.title: Roughlenheatmethod

stabilitymethod.description: Atmospheric stability correction functions for momentum and heat fluxes. Options: 0 (NOT_USED) = Reserved; 1 (NOT_USED2) = Reserved; 2 (HOEGSTROM) = Dyer (1974)/Högström (1988) for momentum, Van Ulden & Holtslag (1985) for stable conditions (not recommended); 3 (CAMPBELL_NORMAN) = Campbell & Norman (1998) formulations for both momentum and heat; 4 (BUSINGER_HOEGSTROM) = Businger et al. (1971)/Högström (1988) formulations (not recommended)
stabilitymethod.note: Provides stability correction functions used by rslmethod calculations
stabilitymethod.title: Stabilitymethod

smdmethod.description: Method for determining soil moisture deficit (SMD). Options: 0 (MODELLED) = SMD calculated from water balance using soil parameters; 1 (OBSERVED_VOLUMETRIC) = Uses observed volumetric soil moisture content (m³/m³) from forcing file; 2 (OBSERVED_GRAVIMETRIC) = Uses observed gravimetric soil moisture content (kg/kg) from forcing file
smdmethod.title: Smdmethod

waterusemethod.description: Method for determining external water use (irrigation). Options: 0 (MODELLED) = Water use calculated based on soil moisture deficit and irrigation parameters; 1 (OBSERVED) = Uses observed water use values from forcing file
waterusemethod.title: Waterusemethod

rslmethod.description: Roughness Sublayer (RSL) method for calculating near-surface meteorological diagnostics (2m temperature, 2m humidity, 10m wind speed). Options: 2 (VARIABLE) = Automatically selects between MOST and RST based on surface morphology (plan area index, frontal area index, and roughness element heights)
rslmethod.note: Determines how near-surface values (2m temp, 10m wind) are calculated from forcing data
rslmethod.title: Rslmethod

faimethod.description: Method for calculating frontal area index (FAI) - the ratio of frontal area to plan area. Options: 0 (USE_PROVIDED) = Use FAI values provided in site parameters (FAIBldg, FAIEveTree, FAIDecTree); 1 (SIMPLE_SCHEME) = Calculate FAI using simple scheme based on surface fractions and heights (see issue #192)
faimethod.title: Faimethod

rsllevel.description: Method for incorporating local environmental feedbacks on surface processes, particularly vegetation phenology and evapotranspiration responses to urban heat island effects. Options: 0 (NONE) = No local climate adjustments; use forcing file meteorology directly; 1 (BASIC) = Simple adjustments for urban temperature effects on leaf area index (LAI) and growing degree days; 2 (DETAILED) = Comprehensive feedbacks including moisture stress, urban CO2 dome effects, and modified phenology cycles
rsllevel.note: Uses near-surface values from rslmethod to modify vegetation processes
rsllevel.title: Rsllevel

gsmodel.description: Stomatal conductance parameterisation method for vegetation surfaces. Options: 1 (JARVI) = Original parameterisation (Järvi et al. 2011) based on environmental controls; 2 (WARD) = Updated parameterisation (Ward et al. 2016) with improved temperature and VPD responses
gsmodel.note: Stomatal conductance model influenced by rsllevel adjustments
gsmodel.title: Gsmodel

snowuse.description: Controls snow process calculations (Järvi et al. 2014). Options: 0 (DISABLED) = Snow processes not included; 1 (ENABLED) = Snow accumulation, melt, and albedo effects included
snowuse.title: Snowuse

stebbsmethod.description: Surface Temperature Energy Balance Based Scheme (STEBBS) for facet temperatures. Options: 0 (NONE) = STEBBS calculations disabled; 1 (DEFAULT) = STEBBS enabled with default parameters; 2 (PROVIDED) = STEBBS enabled with user-specified parameters
stebbsmethod.title: Stebbsmethod

rcmethod.description: Method to split building envelope heat capacity in STEBBS. Options: 0 (NONE) = No heat capacity splitting applied; 1 (PROVIDED) = Use user defined value (fractional x1) between 0 and 1; 2 (PARAMETERISE) = Use building material thermal property to parameterise the weighting factor x1
rcmethod.title: Rcmethod

samealbedo_wall.description: Controls assumption of same albedoes for walls.
samealbedo_wall.title: Samealbedo Wall

samealbedo_roof.description: Controls assumption of same albedoes for roofs.
samealbedo_roof.title: Samealbedo Roof

MomentumRoughnessMethod.description:
Method for calculating momentum roughness length (z0m).

1: FIXED - Fixed roughness length from site parameters
2: VARIABLE - Variable based on vegetation LAI using rule of thumb (Grimmond & Oke 1999)
3: MACDONALD - MacDonald et al. (1998) morphometric method based on building geometry
4: LAMBDAP_DEPENDENT - Varies with plan area fraction λp (Grimmond & Oke 1999)
5: ALTERNATIVE - Alternative variable method
MomentumRoughnessMethod.title: MomentumRoughnessMethod

NetRadiationMethod.description:
Method for calculating net all-wave radiation (Q*).

0: OBSERVED - Uses observed Q* values from forcing file
1: LDOWN_OBSERVED - Models Q* using NARP (Net All-wave Radiation Parameterization; Offerle et al. 2003, Loridan et al. 2011) with observed longwave down radiation (L↓) from forcing file
2: LDOWN_CLOUD - Models Q* using NARP with L↓ estimated from cloud cover fraction
3: LDOWN_AIR - Models Q* using NARP with L↓ estimated from air temperature and relative humidity
11: LDOWN_SURFACE - Surface temperature variant of method 1 (not recommended)
12: LDOWN_CLOUD_SURFACE - Surface temperature variant of method 2 (not recommended)
13: LDOWN_AIR_SURFACE - Surface temperature variant of method 3 (not recommended)
100: LDOWN_ZENITH - Zenith angle correction variant of method 1 (not recommended)
200: LDOWN_CLOUD_ZENITH - Zenith angle correction variant of method 2 (not recommended)
300: LDOWN_AIR_ZENITH - Zenith angle correction variant of method 3 (not recommended)
1001: LDOWN_SS_OBSERVED - SPARTACUS-Surface integration with observed L↓ (experimental)
1002: LDOWN_SS_CLOUD - SPARTACUS-Surface integration with L↓ from cloud fraction (experimental)
1003: LDOWN_SS_AIR - SPARTACUS-Surface integration with L↓ from air temperature/humidity (experimental)
NetRadiationMethod.title: NetRadiationMethod

a1.description: OHM coefficient a1: dimensionless coefficient relating storage heat flux to net radiation
a1.title: A1

a2.description: OHM coefficient a2: time coefficient relating storage heat flux to rate of change of net radiation
a2.title: A2

a3.description: OHM coefficient a3: constant offset term for storage heat flux
a3.title: A3

OHM_Coefficient_season_wetness.description: OHM coefficients for different seasonal and wetness conditions.

summer_dry.description: OHM coefficient for summer dry conditions

summer_wet.description: OHM coefficient for summer wet conditions

winter_dry.description: OHM coefficient for winter dry conditions

winter_wet.description: OHM coefficient for winter wet conditions

OHM_Coefficient_season_wetness.title: Seasonal/Wetness OHM Coefficients

OhmIncQf.description:
Controls inclusion of anthropogenic heat flux in OHM storage heat calculations.

0: EXCLUDE - Use Q* only (required when StorageHeatMethod=1)
1: INCLUDE - Use Q*+QF (for other OHM-based storage heat methods)
OhmIncQf.title: OhmIncQf

format.description: Output file format. Options: 'txt' for traditional text files (one per year/grid/group), 'parquet' for single Parquet file containing all data

freq.description: Output frequency in seconds. Must be a multiple of the model timestep (tstep). If not specified, defaults to 3600 (hourly)
freq.title: Freq

groups.description: List of output groups to save (only applies to txt format). Available groups: 'SUEWS', 'DailyState', 'snow', 'ESTM', 'RSL', 'BL', 'debug'. If not specified, defaults to ['SUEWS', 'DailyState']
groups.title: Groups

path.description: Output directory path where result files will be saved. If not specified, defaults to current working directory.
path.title: Path

OutputFormat.description:
Output file format options.

TXT: Traditional text files (one per year/grid/group)
PARQUET: Single Parquet file containing all output data (efficient columnar format)
OutputFormat.title: OutputFormat

PavedProperties.description:
Properties for paved surfaces including roads, pavements, and parking areas.

Paved surfaces are impervious areas that prevent water infiltration and contribute
to urban runoff. They typically have high thermal mass and low albedo, contributing
significantly to the urban heat island effect.

sfr.description: Surface fraction of grid area covered by this surface type
sfr.title: Sfr

ohm_threshsw.description: Summer/winter threshold based on temperature for OHM calculation
ohm_threshsw.title: Ohm Threshsw

ohm_threshwd.description: Soil moisture threshold determining whether wet/dry OHM coefficients are applied
ohm_threshwd.title: Ohm Threshwd

soildepth.description: Depth of soil layer below surface for hydrological calculations, controlling sub-surface water storage and drainage processes. Site-specific value typically determined from soil surveys or borehole data
soildepth.title: Soildepth

soilstorecap.description: Maximum water storage capacity of soil layer, representing total water holding capacity between field capacity and wilting point. Site-specific value dependent on soil texture, structure, and depth
soilstorecap.title: Soilstorecap

statelimit.description: Minimum water storage capacity for state change
statelimit.title: Statelimit

wetthresh.description: Surface wetness threshold for OHM calculations
wetthresh.title: Wetthresh

sathydraulicconduct.description: Saturated hydraulic conductivity of soil layer, controlling water drainage rate through fully saturated soil. Site-specific value determined from soil texture (higher for sandy, lower for clay); typically measured via laboratory or field infiltration tests
sathydraulicconduct.title: Sathydraulicconduct

waterdist.description: Water distribution fractions for paved surfaces

snowpacklimit.description: Limit of snow that can be held on surface
snowpacklimit.title: Snowpacklimit

irrfrac.description: Fraction of surface area that can be irrigated
irrfrac.title: Irrfrac

PavedProperties.title: Paved Surfaces

RCMethod.description:
Method to split building envelope heat capacity in STEBBS.

0: NONE - No heat capacity splitting applied
1: PROVIDED - Use user defined value (fractional x1) between 0 and 1
2: PARAMETERISE - Use building material thermal property to parameterise the weighting factor x1
RCMethod.title: RCMethod

RSLLevel.description:
Method for incorporating local environmental feedbacks on surface processes, particularly vegetation phenology and evapotranspiration responses to urban heat island effects.

0: NONE - No local climate adjustments; use forcing file meteorology directly
1: BASIC - Simple adjustments for urban temperature effects on leaf area index (LAI) and growing degree days
2: DETAILED - Comprehensive feedbacks including moisture stress, urban CO2 dome effects, and modified phenology cycles
RSLLevel.title: RSLLevel

RSLMethod.description:
Roughness Sublayer (RSL) method for calculating near-surface meteorological diagnostics (2m temperature, 2m humidity, 10m wind speed).

0: MOST (Monin-Obukhov Similarity Theory) - Appropriate for relatively homogeneous, flat surfaces
1: RST (Roughness Sublayer Theory; Theeuwes et al. 2019) - Appropriate for heterogeneous urban surfaces with tall roughness elements
2: VARIABLE - Automatically selects between MOST and RST based on surface morphology (plan area index, frontal area index, and roughness element heights)
RSLMethod.title: RSLMethod

Reference.description: Evidence supporting parameter choices (literature, data sources, expert knowledge, etc.).

ID.description: Identifier for the reference (e.g., citation key)
ID.title: Id

DOI.description: Digital Object Identifier for the reference
DOI.title: Doi

Reference.title: Reference Info

statelimit.description: Minimum water storage capacity for state change
statelimit.title: Statelimit

soilstorecap.description: Maximum water storage capacity of soil
soilstorecap.title: Soilstorecap

wetthresh.description: Surface wetness threshold for OHM calculations
wetthresh.title: Wetthresh

roof_albedo_dir_mult_fact.description: Directional albedo multiplication factor for roofs
roof_albedo_dir_mult_fact.title: Roof Albedo Dir Mult Fact

SMDMethod.description:
Method for determining soil moisture deficit (SMD).

0: MODELLED - SMD calculated from water balance using soil parameters
1: OBSERVED_VOLUMETRIC - Uses observed volumetric soil moisture content (m³/m³) from forcing file
2: OBSERVED_GRAVIMETRIC - Uses observed gravimetric soil moisture content (kg/kg) from forcing file
SMDMethod.title: SMDMethod

SPARTACUSParams.description:
SPARTACUS radiation model parameters.

Controls the SPARTACUS-Surface radiation scheme for detailed
3D radiation interactions in urban environments.

air_ext_lw.description: Air extinction coefficient for longwave radiation
air_ext_lw.title: Air Ext Lw

air_ext_sw.description: Air extinction coefficient for shortwave radiation
air_ext_sw.title: Air Ext Sw

air_ssa_lw.description: Air single scattering albedo for longwave radiation
air_ssa_lw.title: Air Ssa Lw

air_ssa_sw.description: Air single scattering albedo for shortwave radiation
air_ssa_sw.title: Air Ssa Sw

ground_albedo_dir_mult_fact.description: Multiplication factor for direct ground albedo
ground_albedo_dir_mult_fact.title: Ground Albedo Dir Mult Fact

n_stream_lw_urban.description: Number of streams for longwave radiation in urban areas
n_stream_lw_urban.title: N Stream Lw Urban

n_stream_sw_urban.description: Number of streams for shortwave radiation in urban areas
n_stream_sw_urban.title: N Stream Sw Urban

n_vegetation_region_urban.description: Number of vegetation regions in urban areas
n_vegetation_region_urban.title: N Vegetation Region Urban

sw_dn_direct_frac.description: Fraction of downward shortwave radiation that is direct
sw_dn_direct_frac.title: Sw Dn Direct Frac

use_sw_direct_albedo.description: Flag to use direct albedo for shortwave radiation
use_sw_direct_albedo.title: Use Sw Direct Albedo

veg_ssa_lw.description: Vegetation single scattering albedo for longwave radiation
veg_ssa_lw.title: Veg Ssa Lw

veg_ssa_sw.description: Vegetation single scattering albedo for shortwave radiation
veg_ssa_sw.title: Veg Ssa Sw

SPARTACUSParams.title: SPARTACUS

SameAlbedoRoof.description:
Controls assumption of same albedoes for roofs.

0: OFF
1: ON
SameAlbedoRoof.title: SameAlbedoRoof

SameAlbedoWall.description:
Controls assumption of same albedoes for walls.

0: OFF
1: ON
SameAlbedoWall.title: SameAlbedoWall

Site.description:
Site configuration for SUEWS simulations.

Represents the complete configuration for a single SUEWS simulation site,
including all physical properties, initial states, and model parameters.

gridiv.description: Grid ID for identifying this site in multi-site simulations
gridiv.title: Gridiv

properties.description: Physical and morphological properties of the site

initial_states.description: Initial conditions for model state variables

Site.title: Site Configuration

SiteProperties.description:
Physical and geographical characteristics of the simulation site.

Defines the location, dimensions, surface characteristics, and environmental
parameters for a specific urban site being modelled in SUEWS.

lat.description: Latitude of the site in degrees
lat.title: Lat

lng.description: Longitude of the site in degrees
lng.title: Lng

alt.description: Altitude of the site above sea level
alt.title: Alt

surfacearea.description: Total surface area of the site
surfacearea.title: Surfacearea

z.description: Height at which forcing data are specified, should be within the inertial sublayer above the blending height where values are spatially representative of the urban neighbourhood
z.title: Z

runofftowater.description: Fraction of excess water going to water bodies
runofftowater.title: Runofftowater

lumps.description: Parameters for Local-scale Urban Meteorological Parameterization Scheme

spartacus.description: Parameters for Solar Parametrizations for Radiative Transfer through Urban Canopy Scheme

stebbs.description: Parameters for the STEBBS building energy model

anthropogenic_emissions.description: Parameters for anthropogenic heat and water emissions

soil_observation.description: Soil moisture observation metadata (required if SMDMethod > 0)

n_buildings.description: Number of buildings in the site
n_buildings.title: N Buildings

h_std.description: Standard deviation of building heights in the site
h_std.title: H Std

lambda_c.description: External building surface area to plan area ratio
lambda_c.title: Lambda C

SiteProperties.title: Site Properties

crwmax.description: Maximum water holding capacity of snow
crwmax.title: Crwmax

crwmin.description: Minimum water holding capacity of snow
crwmin.title: Crwmin

preciplimit.description: Temperature threshold for snow vs rain precipitation
preciplimit.title: Preciplimit

preciplimitalb.description: Precipitation threshold for snow albedo aging
preciplimitalb.title: Preciplimitalb

snowlimbldg.description: Maximum snow depth limit on buildings
snowlimbldg.title: Snowlimbldg

snowlimpaved.description: Maximum snow depth limit on paved surfaces
snowlimpaved.title: Snowlimpaved

tau_a.description: Time constant for snow albedo aging in cold snow
tau_a.title: Tau A

tau_f.description: Time constant for snow albedo aging in melting snow
tau_f.title: Tau F

tau_r.description: Time constant for snow albedo aging in refreezing snow
tau_r.title: Tau R

tempmeltfact.description: Hourly temperature melt factor of snow
tempmeltfact.title: Tempmeltfact

radmeltfact.description: Hourly radiation melt factor of snow
radmeltfact.title: Radmeltfact

SnowUse.description:
Controls snow process calculations (Järvi et al. 2014).

0: DISABLED - Snow processes not included
1: ENABLED - Snow accumulation, melt, and albedo effects included
SnowUse.title: SnowUse

SoilObservationConfig.description:
Configuration for observed soil moisture measurements.

Required when SMDMethod = 1 (volumetric) or 2 (gravimetric).
These parameters describe the sensor installation and measurement setup,
not the physical soil properties used by the SUEWS water balance model.

Note:
    - `depth`: Where the sensor is installed, not SUEWS's modelled soil depth
    - `smcap`: Maximum observable moisture, not SUEWS's soil storage capacity
    - `bulk_density`: Only used for gravimetric (SMDMethod=2) conversion

depth.description: Depth of the soil moisture sensor installation
depth.title: Depth

smcap.description: Maximum observable soil moisture (saturated θ or w at sensor location). For volumetric (SMDMethod=1), this is typically ≤1.0 (m³/m³). For gravimetric (SMDMethod=2), values >1.0 are possible (g water/g dry soil).
smcap.title: Smcap

soil_not_rocks.description: Fraction of the measured soil volume that is soil (not rocks)
soil_not_rocks.title: Soil Not Rocks

bulk_density.description: Soil bulk density at the measurement point (used for gravimetric conversion)
bulk_density.title: Bulk Density

SoilObservationConfig.title: Soil Observation Configuration

StabilityMethod.description:
Atmospheric stability correction functions for momentum and heat fluxes.

0: NOT_USED - Reserved
1: NOT_USED2 - Reserved
2: HOEGSTROM - Dyer (1974)/Högström (1988) for momentum, Van Ulden & Holtslag (1985) for stable conditions (not recommended)
3: CAMPBELL_NORMAN - Campbell & Norman (1998) formulations for both momentum and heat
4: BUSINGER_HOEGSTROM - Businger et al. (1971)/Högström (1988) formulations (not recommended)
StabilityMethod.title: StabilityMethod

StebbsMethod.description:
Surface Temperature Energy Balance Based Scheme (STEBBS) for facet temperatures.

0: NONE - STEBBS calculations disabled
1: DEFAULT - STEBBS enabled with default parameters
2: PROVIDED - STEBBS enabled with user-specified parameters
StebbsMethod.title: StebbsMethod

StebbsProperties.description:
STEBBS (Surface Temperature Energy Balance for Building Surfaces) model parameters.

Controls the building energy balance calculations including internal heating/cooling,
building materials properties, and thermal behaviour.

StorageDrainParams.description: Parameters for surface water storage drainage.

store_cap.description: Current water storage capacity - the actual storage capacity available for surface water retention. This represents the depth of water that can be stored on or in the surface before drainage begins. For paved surfaces, this might represent depression storage; for vegetated surfaces, it includes canopy interception storage.
store_cap.title: Store Cap

StorageDrainParams.title: Drainage Parameters

StorageHeatMethod.description:
Method for calculating storage heat flux (ΔQS).

0: OBSERVED - Uses observed ΔQS values from forcing file
1: OHM_WITHOUT_QF - Objective Hysteresis Model using Q* only (use with OhmIncQf=0)
3: ANOHM - Analytical OHM (Sun et al., 2017) - not recommended
4: ESTM - Element Surface Temperature Method (Offerle et al., 2005) - not recommended
5: EHC - Explicit Heat Conduction model with separate roof/wall/ground temperatures
6: DyOHM - Dynamic Objective Hysteresis Model (Liu et al., 2025) with dynamic coefficients
7: STEBBS - use STEBBS storage heat flux for building, others use OHM
StorageHeatMethod.title: StorageHeatMethod

WaterProperties.description:
Properties for water surfaces including rivers, lakes, and fountains.

Water surfaces have unique thermal properties with high heat capacity
and evaporative cooling effects. They moderate local temperatures but
have very low albedo values.

sfr.description: Surface fraction of grid area covered by this surface type
sfr.title: Sfr

ohm_threshwd.title: Ohm Threshwd

soildepth.description: Depth of soil layer below surface for hydrological calculations, controlling sub-surface water storage and drainage processes. Site-specific value typically determined from soil surveys or borehole data
soildepth.title: Soildepth

soilstorecap.description: Maximum water storage capacity of soil layer, representing total water holding capacity between field capacity and wilting point. Site-specific value dependent on soil texture, structure, and depth

wetthresh.title: Wetthresh

sathydraulicconduct.description: Saturated hydraulic conductivity of soil layer, controlling water drainage rate through fully saturated soil. Site-specific value determined from soil texture (higher for sandy, lower for clay); typically measured via laboratory or field infiltration tests
